questions.question: What happens if you hit something while traveling at a significant fraction of the speed of light?
What about some combination of expanding human lifespan, but also just good old fashioned, stable society on a spaceship?
Can I ask you a question on propulsion that's a little bit more out there?
I mean, what do you think about those, first of all, like the millions of reports of UFOs, right?
Do you see in terms of portfolio of solutions, us becoming a multi-planetary species as part of that?
Meaning like, what do people that have financial resources enjoy spending most of their time in?
So do you think it's possible that in the future we're living mostly in a virtual reality world?
To me, the question is, can you do some of the amazing things that make life amazing in virtual worlds?
What are some likely interesting trajectories for the proliferation of AI in society over the next couple of decades?
Is there advice you could say, what does it take to write a great story?
As an author, let me ask you what books had a big impact on your life that you've read?
What was the first powerful book you remember reading that convinced you that this form could have depth?
